segments.text: Uncle Ben , how did the Forbidden City get this name ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , in the feudal society , emperors had supreme power , so his residence was certainly a forbidden palace .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: His residence ? You mean the whole palace ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . The Forbidden City is divided into two parts . The southern section , or the Outer Court was for the emperor to exercise his power over the nation , and the northern part , or the Inner Court was for his royal family .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , unbelievable . This was too luxurious .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Even the whole country belonged to him . That's why he is called the emperor .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: OK , then . I love these unique structured towers with the delicate carvings on them . It's really artistic .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah , the buildings and designs of the Forbidden City are the peak of Chinese traditional architecture , not only scientific but also suitable for living .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I agree . It's definitely a product of wisdom . Well , why were those small animal sculptures placed on the tops of the buildings ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Some of them are mascots and some are symbols of power .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Why are there so many yellow things ? Is yellow the lucky color in China ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , no . In fact , yellow is the symbol of the royal family .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Just like the pattern dragon , right ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Exactly . Here is the Nine-dragon Screen .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , it's really fabulous . I wanna take a picture here .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sure , this will be a really good picture .
segments.speaker: S2
